page.title: 02Introduction (continued)
page.content: This is a little bit of information of Bilbrook. Once part of the ancient Brewood, forest and resting place for John Wesley, this progressive village situated on the border of Staffordshire and Wolverhampton is constantly seeking to upgrade the facilities available to its residents. The village green on the edge of which lies a local inn has recently been improved and the modern village hall has been extended. Some forty acres of pasture land has been acquired and this maintains a green belt between the village and the large Barnhurst estate currently being developed at Pendeford. The Parish Council owned land is earmarked for future general public recreational purposes and an area has been set aside for allotments .
